title: Krishna takes a form that we can access | Soulful Japa
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.text: Two quotes are very central to our discussion of module 12 and it is very central to a little
deeper understanding of the nama. What is a transcendental? This nama is, I want transcendental
nama, transcendental nama is described to be, you know, Ananda Chinmaya Rasa, Sadhu Jwala,
Vigrahasya. The nama is considered to be Chaitanya Rasa Vigraha. It is Chaitanya Rasa Vigraha
nama. So that Chaitanya Rasa Vigraha nama, who is Krishna himself, I want to experience.
But now I cannot experience with my material senses, therefore the Lord has come. Just like
he comes as a deity, he comes as the nama on our tongue. What is the form that Aprakrita nama takes?
Aprakrita nama, transcendental name of the Lord, Shuddha nama of the Lord.
When he comes on my tongue, I am giving attention to the sound that I am chanting.
So Prabhupada says,
that the Lord takes on a form that resembles the form that we access through our senses.
What is the sound that I can access through my senses, which I can access through my attention,
through my mind? What is the sound that I can access? The sound that I chant.
So the,
Shuddha nama also,
nama avatar of any incarnates. Just like the Lord and the deity
incarnation takes a form which resembles the deity in the same way. There is a reason for that also.
The nama avatar also resembles the sound that you produce.
Why? Why does it be like that? Because your attention is on the Shaktiavashya nama,
So it has to be similar when you are following the same sound features of the sound features
of one, your attention is touching the sound features of the other.
So Prabhupada, the first quote in module 12, Lord assumes a form resembling matter body,
like Srila Prabhupada is saying, and read the quote.
You assume a form resembling material body, just to give us instructions like those of
Bhagavad Gita.
But actually you are the Supreme original person.
I therefore offer my respectful obeisance to you.

Anything that is not present in the world, how can we not experience it.
beyond matter in the present conditioned state? Do the dhamas and the Lord himself in his
archa form appear before us resembling matter to give us the facility to see spirit with
material eyes? In the beginning this may be difficult for a neophyte to understand, but
in due course of time when one is advanced in devotional service, it will be easier.
He will appreciate the Lord's presence in the tangible forms. The Lord's name is available
to us in a very tangible form. Tangible means one of the senses can access. I am able to
hear. I am able to chant with my tongue. I am able to hear. By the Lord's omnipotency,
this sound is as good as Krishna. As good as Krishna's original name. As good as Krishna's
Shuddha Nama.
In other words, today I am unable to chant and hear the Shuddha Nama which Rupa Goswami
says, if one is able to do, then one will desire a million tongues and a million ears.
But at the same time, I am also aware that the Lord is present. He is present but I cannot
touch him. Lord is present before me, but I cannot touch him because I do not. I can
only
touch him with my attention. But otherwise I cannot, with my present senses, I cannot
touch him.
So, please see the merciful nature of the Lord, Nama. He knows that we can give attention
only to the Shakti O Vesha Nama. Therefore he takes a sound feature which is identical
to Shakti O Vesha Nama.
Just like the deity, the Lord's spiritual form takes on a deity form which is identical
to the deity so that when you see the deity, you are seeing the transcendental form also.
When you offer anything, you are offering to the Lord.
For the Lord, there is no difference.
For us, there is a difference.
Today, I can touch Shakti Avasya Nama with my tongue, but with my tongue, I cannot chant
Shuddha Nama because this material tongue cannot chant Satchidananda Nama.
I need Satchidananda tongue.
But only attention I can touch, which is great because touching the Aprakrita Nama, touching
the Shakti Avasya Nama.
All energies flow into us as we are experiencing.
Even in our simple starting kindergarten of soulful japa is mindful japa and we are seeing
